intro: Gastrolobium cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burr-wheatear, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is part of the Fabaceae family. The plant produces yellow flowers in late winter to early spring, which are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and the plant is known for its hardy nature in arid conditions. It is also valued for its role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
